message.content:
There are several types of figures of speech, including:


1. Metaphor - using one thing to refer to another thing
2. Simile - comparing two things that are similar
3. Personification - attributing human characteristics to an inanimate object or abstract concept
4. Hyperbole - exaggerating something for effect
5. Allusion - making a reference to something without naming it directly
6. Synecdoche - referring to a part instead of the whole
7. Metonymy - using a symbol or stand-in to represent a thing
8. Personification - attributing human characteristics to an inanimate object or abstract concept
9. Antonyms - contrasting ideas or concepts by using opposite words, phrases, or images
10. Allegory - making a literal interpretation of something symbolic
11. Simile - comparing two things that are similar
12. Metaphor - using one thing to refer to another thing
13. Hyperbole - exaggerating something for effect
14. Synecdoche - referring to a part instead of the whole
15. Symbolism - using a symbol or stand-in to represent a thing
